QUESTION 2: MAP CALCULATIONS AND TECHNIQUES 
 
2.1 
Calculate the straight-line distance, in kilometres, between trigonometrical 
station 294 in block F1 and trigonometrical station 94 in block E1. Show ALL 
calculations.  
  
 
 
Actual Distance = Map Distance x Map Scale 
                         = 4,8 cm  x 0,5 km  
                         = 2,4 km  
                Range [2,3 km to 2,5 km]                                                
     (3 x 1) 
  
 
 
(3) 
 
2.2 
Determine the present magnetic bearing of trigonometrical station 290 in 
block F8 from trigonometrical station 292 in block D9.  
 
                                                                        present  magnetic  declination
true  bearing    
Formula:       Present  magnetic  bearing  
+
=  
 
  
 
 
True bearing = 203° (201 o – 205°)  
Difference in years = 2014 – 2001 
                               = 13 years   
Mean annual change = 9'W  
Total change = 13 x 9'W 
 
 
= 117'W   
                     = 1°57'W  
Magnetic declination in 2014 = 25o29'W +1°57'W  
 
 
                         = 26o86'W   
                                               = 27o26'W  
Magnetic bearing = 203° + 27o26'    
                            = 230o26'  
                           Range [228 o26' to 232 o26']                
          (6 x 1) 
 
(6)
